intro: Calandrinia leeana, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces vibrant purple to pink flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday, adapting to conserve moisture. Its foliage is succulent, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it survive in dry conditions. Calandrinia leeana is often found in sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy and resilient species.
